item.title: Running my server!?
item.dc:creator: @Diablo_Runes Diablo Runes
item.description:
@Diablo_Runes wrote:

Try changing

@echo off title skorge-scape "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m server exit

to

@echo off title skorge-scape "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m server

If that doesnt work, change…

@echo off title skorge-scape "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m server exit

that to…

@echo off title skorge-scape "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe" -Xmx1000m server

This. If it is your run.bat in the server files that is not working, this is my one:

@echo off title DeltaScape java -Xmx512m -cp .;./jython.jar;./MySql/mysql-connector-java-3.0.08-ga-bin.jar server

Read full topic

item.title: Running my server!?
item.dc:creator: @Rej3ctz Rej3ctz
item.description:
@Rej3ctz wrote:

Omg, so i had these trouble’s b4 and i can’t remember whatt to du b/c my “Run” always appears quickly then disappears automatically…like in 0.1ms… i have edited my “run” and changed it too my Java… thats 6u18… here’s what it looks like;

@echo off
title skorge-scape
“C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jdk1.6.0_18\bin\java.exe” -Xmx1000m server
exit

can somebody help me?

Also, it does that when i double-click the Client as well… but a pop-up says;

Windows cannot find “javaw”. Make sure you typed the name correctly, and then try again. To search for a file, click the start button, then click search.

and then ill C+P the client document;

@echo off
start javaw -Xmx500m -cp .;Theme.jar Gui
exit

I’m not new at 317,508,525…i just need a code to C+P it into my run documents for both client and source, thanks…

-Rej3ctz ;D

Read full topic
